The John Birch Society is in search of a full-time motion graphics/editor to join the media production department. The ideal person will work with project leaders and provide input during the entire production process.

The majority of the responsibilities will include putting together weekly programs along with shooting and editing footage for documentary-style videos and animations.

Hi STAN, I am looking for a new resume template. I am 50 years old and have been working in Information security for 30 years. I am currently working as a cloud security architect.  I currently hold the following certs: CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, Terraform Associate, AWS Solutions Architect Associate. By the end of this year, I expect to have the AWS Solution Architect Professional, AWS Security and Kubernetes administrator certs. I would like to keep the resume to 2 pages. I personally don't believe resumes should be longer than 2 pages out of respect for the reviewer. I have hired over 50 people over the years and as you well know, when you have a 100 resumes to get through, you need to grab the reviewers attention in the first 60 seconds. The template needs to be visually strong but also readable so that the drones in HR can scan it into their system. If you still have character limit available, can you provide a 3 paragraph cover letter. I expect to remain as a technical resource as opposed to moving into management. I expect to be promoted at work to a principal consultant role in the next year or two.

STAN:

Based on your requirements, I propose the following resume structure to ensure it stays within the 2-page limit, is visually strong and reader-friendly:

Header:
- Name
- Contact details

Summary:
- Briefly introduce yourself, mention your field expertise and the desired role

Experience:
- Current role: Cloud Security Architect (dates of employment, company)
    * List major accomplishments and responsibilities, focusing on the most relevant ones

- Previous roles in Information Security, in reverse chronological order (dates of employment, companies)
    * Highlight relevant responsibilities and key achievements for each role

Certifications (with dates of issuance):
- CISSP
- CISA
- CISM
- CRISC
- Terraform Associate
- AWS Solutions Architect Associate
- Forthcoming certifications: AWS Solution Architect Professional, AWS Security, Kubernetes Administrator (expected end of the year)

Skills:
- List relevant skills, with focus on technical expertise and knowledge of specific tools, software, or platforms

Education:
- List degrees, universities, and year of graduation

As for the cover letter, here's a suggested structure:

Paragraph 1:
Introduce yourself and mention your desire to apply for the specific position. Briefly touch upon your extensive experience in information security and your current role as a cloud security architect.

Paragraph 2:
Address your long-term experience and your technical certifications that make you the ideal candidate. Emphasize your accomplishments throughout your career and the value you'd bring to the company. Explain your long-term goals of remaining a technical resource, mentioning that you see yourself promoted to a principal consultant role in the near future.

Paragraph 3:
Express your interest in the company and how your expertise would contribute to its success. Close by stating your eagerness to discuss your qualifications during an interview and provide your contact details for further communication.

I'll give you two inputs: a resume and a job description. Then write a cover letter for the position. First the resume:

PROFILE

A highly skilled process engineer with deep experience in manufacturing environments. Possessing a diverse background across various industries such as oil and gas, plastics, lubricants, and steelmaking. Further experience with programming, automation, and full-stack development. Motivated and detail-oriented, capable of excelling in both team-based and independent work environments
Driven to utilize strong technical skills and commitment to sustainability to drive innovation and create a positive impact on the environment and society while bringing value to the organization
 

TECHNICAL SKILLS

•	Experience in both upstream oil sands and downstream refining operations, focusing on distillation, sour water treatment, and fluid catalytic / delayed coking technologies
•	Significant experience in delivering technical support for day-to-day operations, short-term optimization initiatives, as well as unit turnarounds and long-term projects to improve yield and throughput
•	Thorough knowledge of P&IDs, equipment degradation mechanisms, sizing pressure relief devices, restriction orifices, and working with process control and instrumentation datasheets
•	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements (API, ASME, OSHA), design practices and safe operating principles (HAZOPs, SRRs, PHAs); experienced in use of design and modeling software (PRO/II, Aspen HYSYS, Pegasys#, etc)

•	Expertise in transforming technical data into practical reports/presentations using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio; strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, React, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
 

EDUCATION

Bachelor of Science, Chemical Engineering (Honours), University of Waterloo, Waterloo, ON	April 2013
•	Option in Management Sciences
 

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Independent Consultant, Toronto, ON	December 2021 - Present
Full-stack Web Developer
•	Collaborated with a team of developers to build modern and responsive web applications, leveraging HTML/CSS/JavaScript for front-end and Node.js/React.js for back-end development 
•	Built semantically structured full stack web applications and deployed on AWS and Azure hosting services
•	Applied SCRUM agile methodology for project management to streamline development and ensure robust communications with customers
•	Utilized relational (MySQL) and non-relational databases (MongoDB) based on client needs; utilized GitHub for version control and branch logic

 
ExxonMobil, Baton Rouge, LA	December 2017 - June 2020
Delayed Coker Technical Lead
•	Provided technical leadership for operation of a 110 KBPD delayed coking complex, serving as interface between technical organization and greater business leadership team
•	Delivered daily guidance and mentorship of junior process engineers; effective process monitoring avoided $2.0M/year in losses and a further $600k increase in liquid yield through optimization initiatives
•	Sustained identification and advancement of long-term improvement opportunities; technical lead for various large capital projects ($100M+) such as slide-valve implementation for coke drums
•	Served as technical lead for West Coker planned turnaround; timely inspections and thorough repair reports led to process technical work scope completing 2 days ahead of schedule
 

Syncrude Canada, Fort McMurray, AB	October 2013 - December 2017
Process Contact Engineer 
•	Directed routine unit monitoring for conversion units (distillation/vacuum tower, fluid coker) to identify short-term and long-term unit issues preventing liquid yield losses of $1.5M/year
•	Led unit alarm rationalization for all tags in unit's alarm database; leveraged disciplines to set parameters based on process trends, equipment strategies, and operator knowledge, reducing nuisance alarms and bad actor alarms by over 80%
•	Provided technical support for mechanical outages for conversion units by inspecting vessels and delivering recommendations on required repairs; avoided delays to critical path work preventing losses of $400k/day
•	Engaged with external vendors and Syncrude R&D on improvement projects to extend unit run length by 20% and, to increase liquid yield by 0.4% resulting in annual value creation of $12M
 

NOVA Chemicals, Mississauga, ON	May 2012 – August 2012
Process Design Intern
•	Validated 80+ pressure relief devices including pressure safety valves, rupture disks, and tank vents to ensure operational safety of pumps, compressors, and heat exchangers
•	Developed a procedure to size pressure relief devices for supercritical fluid overpressure scenarios, enabling sizing of 20+ pressure relief devices in supercritical service
•	Analyzed piping for high pressure equipment using PipeFlow software and proposed over 10 solutions for reducing inlet pressure losses to relief devices and centrifugal pumps
•	Established regular communication with operators to gather plant data to create missing isometrics and rectify outdated process and instrumentation diagrams, creating 100+ isometric drawings


Now the job description:

Are you an experienced sales engineer looking for your next challenge? Are you looking to apply your technical and sales skills in a new arena? If so, read on!

Kickr Design is looking for an experienced off-site Business Development Engineer that is interested in joining a growing company in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a passion for engineering, advanced product design (Medical Devices, high technology, industrial automation), is excellent at developing strong relationships with prospects, and can demonstrate an ability to quickly and creatively solve problems. The position also requires an individual that works well on their own, interacts with clients with professionalism, and is confident in his/her own sales and business development skills.

We are looking for a candidate with a very strong engineering background, who has been on the leading edge of business development or sales engineering in a highly technical field. The ideal candidate will have worked in multiple industries as an engineer and have a strong breadth of knowledge in mechanical and electrical systems as well as excellent communication skills and a passion for closing those elusive customers!

As a Business Development Engineer, you will own the outside business development arena and drive our company's growth by winning new deals for our talented, diverse engineering team. You will seek out and court prospects ranging from startups to large brands and businesses, each with their own completely unique products and engineering challenges. You will leverage Kickr Designs extensive engineering capability in your discussions, finding interesting problems that our engineering team can help solve across multiple industries, engineering disciplines and project types.

Key Tasks:

Prospect customers, arrange meetings and on-site visits

Attend events locally in Atlanta, GA, the Southeast and select events around the country on behalf of Kickr Design

Network and meet potential customers while fostering relationships with prospects.

You will setup project consultations with a wide range of unique companies over the phone or in-person

Speak directly with clients and provide helpful engineering insights in conversation

Draft & send personalized proposals/estimates for new projects

Attend project "Kick-Off" meetings & hand off project to engineering team

Work with the Sales Engineering team to close jobs

Requirements

Minimum Bachelors degree in Engineering (any discipline)

Well-rounded engineering knowledge

Ability to discuss and brainstorm a wide variety of solutions to a hugely diverse set of potential problems

5 years customer facing experience in Sales, Sales Engineering or Business Development

Excellent interpersonal skills are a MUST!

Excellent oral and written communication skills are a MUST!

How would you go about debugging a Docker container?

Give me a short answer

To debug a Docker container, first, identify the container by running `docker ps`. Then, use `docker logs <container_id>` to view logs and identify potential issues. If needed, access the container's shell with `docker exec -it <container_id> /bin/bash` (or `/bin/sh`) to explore further or interactively debug the application within the container.
What are API 650 and API 620 used for? Provide details

API 650 and API 620 are two widely accepted design standards for the construction of storage tanks, established by the American Petroleum Institute (API).

1. API 650: This standard covers the design, fabrication, and erection of aboveground, vertical, cylindrical, closed- and open-top welded storage tanks for internal pressures approximating atmospheric pressure (up to a maximum of 2.5 psi). It is predominantly used for designing storage tanks that store oil, petroleum, water, and chemicals at ambient temperature. API 650 specifies requirements for materials, design, fabrication, and testing of tanks, primarily focusing on maintaining the structural integrity and safety of tanks under atmospheric pressure conditions. It addresses roof design, shell and bottom plate design, foundation design, and other requirements to ensure tank stability and longevity.

2. API 620: This standard governs the design and construction of large, welded, low-pressure carbon steel above-ground storage tanks, including flat-bottom tanks designed for storage of lower-viscosity liquids that may require higher internal pressures (up to 15 psi) or have lower temperature limits (-325 to +250 degrees Fahrenheit). API 620 is typically used for tanks storing cryogenic liquids such as liquified gases, as well as certain chemicals and high-vapor pressure substances. Similar to API 650, it provides guidelines on materials, design, construction, inspection, and testing to ensure these tanks withstand higher internal pressures and keep their contents securely stored.

Both standards aim to ensure proper and safe storage of various substances and are utilized in industries such as oil and gas, refining, petrochemical, and chemical storage. These standards are maintained and periodically updated to reflect current best practices for design, fabrication, and construction in the industry.
What is the typical project workflow in an EPC? Describe in detail

An EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) project is a contracting approach where a single contractor is responsible for completing design, procurement, and construction activities for an infrastructure project. This approach streamlines project management and reduces overall project risks. The typical project workflow in an EPC can be divided into several stages, as detailed below:

1. Initial Consultation and Pre-Engineering Phase: EPC contractors meet with project owners and stakeholders to understand project objectives, goals, constraints, and requirements. Feasibility studies, site assessments, preliminary cost estimations, and scheduling are performed to outline project scope, budget, and timeline.

2. Conceptual Design and Basic Engineering: Based on the pre-engineering findings, EPC contractors develop a conceptual design, specifying the layout, process flow, and systems required for the project. This phase may also involve acquiring necessary permits, regulatory approvals, and environmental clearances.

3. Detailed Engineering and Design: EPC teams refine the conceptual design into a comprehensive engineering package, including detailed mechanical, electrical, structural, instrumentation, and control system designs. These designs are validated through computer simulations, modeling, and other analysis to ensure the project meets all technical specifications, safety regulations, and functional requirements.

4. Procurement: EPC contractors procure all required equipment, materials, and services, including subcontractors, suppliers, and labor. Procurement activities often include negotiations, contracts, logistics, transportation, and quality control of purchased items.

5. Construction: EPC contractors oversee the entire construction process, including site preparation, civil works, equipment and system installation, infrastructure development, and utility integration. They monitor construction progress, ensure quality and safety, and manage any on-site changes or contract modifications.

6. Commissioning, Testing, and Startup: After construction, EPC teams perform system testing, quality checks, and commissioning activities to ensure the facility operates as designed. This phase includes calibration, functional testing, performance testing, and collaboration with operational teams.

7. Project Handover and Closeout: Upon successful commissioning, the EPC contractor hands over the project to the owner, including all necessary documentation, operating manuals, warranties, spare parts inventory, and training of personnel. A final project report is generated, and a project closeout process includes addressing any outstanding issues, outstanding payments, or dispute resolution.

Throughout the EPC project workflow, communication, and coordination between the EPC contractor, project owner, and other stakeholders is critical to ensuring that the project runs smoothly, stays within budget, and is completed on schedule. Risk management and mitigation also play an integral role in each stage of the project workflow.
What are some strategic ways of thinking vs task oriented ways of thinking? Clarify the distinction with some examples

Strategic thinking and task-oriented thinking are two different approaches to problem-solving and planning. While strategic thinking focuses on long-term goals, holistic perspectives, and the overall direction of a project or organization, task-oriented thinking emphasizes short-term goals, specific actions, and efficient execution of tasks. Here are some distinctions between strategic and task-oriented thinking, along with examples:

Strategic Thinking:
1. Long-term focus: Strategic thinking concentrates on setting and achieving long-term objectives and envisioning the desired future state. Example: A business owner plans to expand their company geographically over the next five years.
2. Holistic perspective: Strategic thinkers consider the whole picture, including external factors, competition, market trends, and potential risks. Example: A marketing manager analyzes competitors, consumer demands, and market trends before outlining a comprehensive marketing strategy.
3. Adaptability: Strategic thinking involves anticipating possible changes and developing contingency plans. Example: A CEO devises a diversification strategy to reduce dependency on one product line after assessing market shifts and potential threats.
4. Innovation and creativity: Strategic thinkers look for new opportunities and unconventional solutions to seize competitive advantages. Example: An R&D director explores emerging technologies to develop innovative products to increase market share in their industry.

Task-Oriented Thinking:
1. Short-term focus: Task-oriented thinking emphasizes immediate objectives, frequently breaking down complex goals into smaller, achievable tasks. Example: A project manager breaks down the project into several milestones, delegating individual tasks to team members.
2. Details and execution: Task-oriented thinkers concentrate on the specifics of tasks, focusing on efficient execution and completion. Example: A software developer focuses on writing efficient code, following coding standards, and debugging to deliver a functional feature.
3. Technical expertise: Task-oriented thinking often requires specific skills and knowledge related to individual tasks or roles. Example: An accountant leverages their expertise in tax laws and regulations to complete tax filings accurately and on time.
4. Monitoring and control: Task-oriented thinkers track performance, deadlines, and resources to ensure tasks are completed as planned. Example: A production supervisor oversees daily operations, monitoring machinery, output quality, and employee productivity.

In a well-balanced team or organization, both strategic and task-oriented thinking are essential. Strategic thinking sets the direction and long-term goals, while task-oriented thinking ensures that daily operations are efficient in achieving those goals.

conversation.content:
Verbeter deze sollicitatiebrief:

Hi Pim,

Ik mail u naar aanleiding van de vacature "Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb". Ik liep toevallig langs jullie kantoor in Nijmegen toen het gevoel me bekroop dat dit wel eens precies de plek kan zijn waar ik naar op zoek ben.


 

Ik stel me graag even voor; mijn naam is Fabian van der Niet, ik ben 31 jaar en op zoek naar een bedrijf die Zorg en Software samenbrengt. Ik ben namelijk opgeleid als HBO Vaktherapeut, maar merkte al snel dat ik ook veel passie heb voor het bieden van zorg middels software. Tijdens het afronden van de opleiding ben ik me dan ook gaan verdiepen in softwaredesign (UI/UX) en het aanleren van HTML/CSS/JS. Dit met als doel, een app te kunnen maken voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling: "innerDex". Indertijd heb ik ook als verkoopadviseur gewerkt in een Apple store, uiteraard met de nodige targets.

 

"innerDex" is nog steeds mijn passie-project, maar ik ben mij professioneel gaan ontwikkelen als bedrijf/marketing-adviseur, softwaredesigner en product manager bij verschillende opdrachtgevers. Dit deed ik uitsluitend bij opdrachtgevers die gemoeid waren met (mentale) zorg, aangezien dat aansluit bij mijn gevoel van zingeving.

 

Ik ben altijd happig om professioneel door te ontwikkelen. Vanuit deze ervaring zal ik dan ook, middels het STAP-budget, in mei een certificaat product-owner (PSPO-1) binnenhalen. (een PO is iemand die met stakeholders in gesprek gaat en de productontwikkeling stuurt op basis van prioriteiten). 

 

Inmiddels heb ik jaren ervaring in de combinatie zorg&software, en ben ik op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging om me in vast te bijten. Jullie bedrijf spreekt me dan ook ontzettend aan! Ik ben op zoek naar iets dat aansluit bij mijn ervaring, maar me ook iets nieuws kan leren. Daarom zou ik graag eens met jullie in gesprek gaan over de functie "Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb".

 

Als implementatieadviseur bij Triaspect krijg ik de kans om niet met stakeholders, maar juist met de eindgebruikers in gesprek te gaan. Een groot deel van mijn werkzaamheden afgelopen jaren bestond al uit het mondeling begeleiden bij het gebruik van de software-functionaliteiten, waar ik veel plezier in had. Zodra ik in jullie software ben gedoken, vermoed ik ook daar veel voldoening uit te halen. Ieder zorgteam is anders, en ik kan me voorstellen dat ik me bezig zal houden met het (uit)vinden van de beste oplossingen voor de problemen waar teams tegenaanlopen mbt de implementatie van de software. Mijn bewezen geduld, scherpte in bewoordingen en kwaliteiten in het "zien van the bigger picture" zal in de gesprekken met klanten/gebruikers goed van pas komen.

 

Bij deze functie lijkt de nadruk te liggen op het onderhouden van klant-relaties, het helpen wegwijs maken in de software en, waar mogelijk, het realiseren van aanvullende acquisitie. Dit zijn allen werkzaamheden waar ik mijn huidige ervaring en kwaliteiten goed in kwijt kan, maar me ook nog graag in zou ontwikkelen.

 

Wat mij nog het meest enthousiasmeert, is de gewenste betrokkenheid bij de productontwikkeling. Daarin zal mijn ervaring en expertise het meest tot z'n recht komen. Het betekent dat ik niet alleen kansen moet gaan zien die zorgen dat klanten meer waarde uit onze hoofdsoftware en aanvullende producten haalt, maar ook kansen om de software nog beter/gebruiksvriendelijker te maken. Daar kan ik mijn ervaring als softwaredesigner en product manager gebruiken om -nu vanuit het perspectief van de gebruiker- suggesties voor innovaties aan te leveren.

 

Al met al lijkt deze vacature een perfecte balans te zijn tussen het inzetten van mijn kwaliteiten en het professioneel ontwikkelen op nieuwe gebieden. Maar laten we beginnen bij het kopje koffie.

 

U zult inmiddels vast kennis genomen hebben van mijn gepassioneerde karakter. Die komt alleen vrij als iets mij oprecht interesseert. De functie sluit aan bij wat ik wil bijdragen aan de wereld. Daarnaast kan ik hier ontwikkelen op nog onbegane gebieden, en vermoed ik jullie veel te kunnen bieden, mogelijk op nog onvoorziene wijze.

 

Ik zou graag eens met u in gesprek gaan om te ontdekken of dat waar is, en of we daar hetzelfde over denken.

 

Ik kijk uit naar een ontmoeting!

 

Met hartelijke groet,

Fabian van der Niet

Beste Pim,

Via deze weg wil ik u informeren over mijn interesse in de vacature “Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb”. Tijdens mijn wandeling langs jullie kantoor in Nijmegen, besefte ik dat deze baan wel eens de perfecte match zou kunnen zijn voor mijn ambities en vaardigheden.

Graag stel ik mezelf even voor; mijn naam is Fabian van der Niet, ik ben 31 jaar en ik zoek naar een bedrijf dat de werelden van zorg en software verenigt. Als afgestudeerd HBO Vaktherapeut en liefhebber van zorg, ontdekte ik een andere passie in het bieden van zorg via software. Zo ben ik mij gaan verdiepen in softwaredesign (UI/UX) en het aanleren van HTML/CSS/JS tijdens het afronden van mijn opleiding. Met als resultaat: de ontwikkeling van mijn eigen app voor persoonlijke groei, genaamd “innerDex”. Na mijn werk als verkoopadviseur bij een Apple store, waar targets centraal stonden, richtte ik mij op freelance werk als bedrijfs/marketingadviseur, softwaredesigner en productmanager die zich enkel en alleen bezighielden in de (mentale) zorgsector omdat deze het beste aansloten bij mijn gevoel van voldoening.

Met een ruime ervaring in de combinatie van zorg en software, ben ik nu op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging bij Triaspect. Het Certificaat Product Owner (PSPO-1), dat ik via het STAP-budget in mei wil behalen, zie ik als een waardevolle toevoeging aan mijn professionele ontwikkeling. Een rol als Implementatieadviseur geeft mij, naast het werken met stakeholders, de kans om in contact te komen met eindgebruikers. In de afgelopen jaren heb ik veel ervaring opgedaan in het mondeling begeleiden van gebruikers bij het gebruik van software-functionaliteiten en ik verwacht dit met veel plezier ook voor jullie software te kunnen doen. Ik ben ervan overtuigd dat het werken met verschillende zorgteams zal leiden tot het vinden van de meest effectieve oplossingen voor de uitdagingen die zij ondervinden bij de implementatie van de software. Mijn bewezen vaardigheden in geduldige, nauwkeurige bewoordingen en de kwaliteit om het grotere plaatje te zien, zijn zeer waardevol in gesprekken met klanten en gebruikers.

In deze baan zal ik mij vooral bezighouden met het onderhouden van goede klantrelaties, het wegwijs maken van gebruikers in de software en het realiseren van aanvullende acquisitie. Deze werkzaamheden waardeer ik zeer en zie ik als een kans om mijn huidige vaardigheden in te zetten en nieuwe te ontwikkelen. Wat mij een extra boost geeft, is de betrokkenheid bij de productontwikkeling. Hier kan ik mijn ervaring als softwaredesigner en productmanager inzetten om, vanuit het perspectief van de gebruiker, suggesties te doen voor innovatie en verbetering.

Kortom, de vacature van Implementatieadviseur bij Triaspect lijkt de perfecte balans te zijn tussen het gebruiken van mijn huidige vaardigheden en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe. Ik ben enthousiast om met jullie te ontmoeten om te ontdekken of wij dezelfde verwachtingen en doelen hebben.

Graag een kop koffie om nader kennis te maken!

Met vriendelijke groet,

Fabian van der Niet

The Job Posting:
Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher
Annie Wright Schools seek a Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher to begin on August 18, 2023. This is a full-time position and reports directly to the Middle School Director.

Mission Statement
Annie Wright’s strong community cultivates individual learners to become well-educated, creative, and responsible citizens for a global society.

About AWS
Tradition meets innovation at Annie Wright Schools, where we honor our rich history and traditions, embrace the present, and continue always to move forward. Founded in 1884, Annie Wright Schools serve students from age three through high school. The Lower and Middle Schools offer co-ed programs in Preschool through Grade 8, while separate Upper Schools for boys and girls offer day and boarding options in Grades 9 through 12, welcoming students from Tacoma and around the world. We are proud to be an International Baccalaureate World School, delivering IB programs in every division.

Position Description
The Middle School Digital Media & Design teacher is passionate about what they do and who they teach. They recognize and appreciate that the Design process and the creative process of the Arts go hand-in-hand. 

In Digital Media, the ideal candidate has the knowledge and enthusiasm to bring digital technology to life for our students through inquiry and discovery of the artistic process. This exploration into the concepts of change, communication, aesthetics, and identity could take the form of synthesized music, animation, digital art, videography, photography, or a wide spectrum of other artistic platforms that use digital media. This is a new course and, thus, the specifics of the units taught can fit the interests, talents, and passions of the teacher. Our one-to-one MacBook program means our students are equipped with a powerful tool to explore their creative world. In addition, they will have exposure to more classical visual art and theater classes to support growth in this course. Experience with applications from Adobe Creative Cloud is expected. 

The Design course at AWS is based around a maker space filled with duct tape, glue guns, and cardboard. With access to a woodshop, textiles lab, 3-D printers, and other tools, the ideal candidate allows students to creatively solve problems in a hands-on manner through human-centered, empathy-focused problem solving. All projects follow the IB MYP Design Cycle which encourages students to inquire and analyze, develop ideas, create a solution, and evaluate both their process and end product. For example, students may be tasked with designing a cardboard arcade game to appeal to a Grade 3 audience. They start by interviewing Grade 3 students, build a game, test it with a Grade 3 audience, make adjustments as needed, and evaluate the success of the process. As the facilitator of this course, no prior experience in the subject is required. However, enthusiasm for inquiry, the ability to guide students in a creative brainstorming process, and a passion for hands-on exploration are all essential qualities of a successful teacher of this course. Our students document their journey through both Digital Media and Design using Adobe Express and record their thoughts and progress in both courses over the three years of Middle School. 

Strong positive relationships and effective community-building are essential in Middle School; therefore, the Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher must connect with young adolescents of all backgrounds and abilities to enable them to explore the world from multiple perspectives with eagerness and drive. Compassion and an understanding of the needs of this age group are vital to simultaneously support each student's academic and social-emotional growth and hold them accountable for their actions and choices. 

While energy, patience, and a little bit of goofiness are key elements that are indispensable for this position, the Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher is also a team player who thrives in collaborative endeavors, both as an advisor and as a subject specialist in the Arts and Design departments. The creation and implementation of interdisciplinary units of inquiry that captivate, inform, and stretch our students are also essential components of the Middle Years Programme. While experience with the International Baccalaureate (IB) is not a prerequisite, an appreciation of criterion-based grading and a global, holistic approach to the IB is important. 

Position Overview: Core Duties & Responsibilities
The Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher: 
teaches in alignment with the mission and philosophy of Annie Wright Schools and with the International Baccalaureate framework; 
designs and teaches Digital Media & Design with an emphasis on collaboration with the other Art (theater and visual arts) and Design teachers
collaborates with other faculty, including the Director of Middle School, student Advisors, the Middle School Counselor, and other colleagues to develop programming;
participates in collaborative planning and faculty meetings, serves as a Middle School Advisor, and fulfills other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
The Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher will demonstrate key elements of the listed expertise and experiences. This is an aspirational list, and Annie Wright Schools encourages candidates to apply who may not currently possess but who are working on building all of these qualities. The Middle School Digital Media & Design Teacher: 
holds a BA in Art, Music, Design, Education, or a related field;
is familiar with independent schools and/or the International Baccalaureate framework;
demonstrates success as a teacher at the Middle School level and an interest in interdisciplinary curriculum development;
demonstrates enthusiasm for working with Middle School-aged students and the ability to form authentic relationships with them; 
demonstrates proficiency in educational technologies, specifically with Adobe Suite/Creative Cloud;
is a strong communicator and empathetic listener;
is innovative;
is organized and flexible;
practices cultural humility in personal interactions;
is eligible to work in the United States. (Note: Under our current employment policies, we are unable to sponsor work visas and do not offer positions to candidates who are not yet eligible to work in the United States.)

conversation.content: Tropical rainforests receive consistently high rainfall throughout the year, with annual rainfall typically exceeding 2000 millimeters (80 inches). Rainforests are characterized by a warm and wet climate, with little variation in temperature throughout the year. Daytime temperatures in lowland tropical rainforests usually hover around 30-32°C (86-90°F), while nighttime temperatures rarely drop below 20°C (68°F). There is often a high level of humidity due to the constant evaporation and condensation of water, creating a damp and muggy environment.

I am writing this letter because I know that your honorable company, is located in the critical worker pilot in the province of New Brunswick, develops poultry farming and brings qualified labor from abroad, for which I am prepared for the development of the production plans. your company in different areas of poultry farming.
I am a Venezuelan Veterinary Doctor, with more than 20 years of work experience in different areas of animal production, I also have a master's degree in educational technology, I come from a family with 5 Veterinary doctors, my father had a farm with different animal species, which stimulated passion for animal health and production, as well as agricultural safety and environmentally friendly and profitable agriculture.
Since I was a child I have been interested in animal health and because people consume healthy animal meat, that is where my interest in processing meat and interest in the preparation of sausages and smoked foods was born, although I developed an ability for the artificial insemination of cows and pigs, as well as the management of broiler chickens, achieving increases in the reproductive efficiency of the farms and the decrease in mortality in newborn calves, as well as the decrease in abortions in dairy cows.
When I saw the offer of the Critical worker Pilot of New Brunswick on the Canada migration page and I observed your company Groupe Westc, I knew immediately that you could take me to work with you, for this reason I offer you my knowledge to develop a good job in my areas of performance, which I will know how to perform in a good way-

Subject: Application for Veterinary Doctor Position at Groupe Westc

Dear [Hiring Manager's Name],

I am writing to express my strong interest in joining Groupe Westc as a Veterinary Doctor. I learned about your company's involvement in the Critical Worker Pilot program in the province of New Brunswick and admired the dedication to the development of poultry farming and the support for bringing qualified professionals from abroad. As an experienced veterinary doctor with a passion for animal health and production, I believe I would make a valuable contribution to your company.

With more than 20 years of experience in various areas of animal production, I am well-equipped to support the growth of your company across different facets of poultry farming. I hold a Veterinary Doctor degree from Venezuela and a Master's degree in Educational Technology. Growing up in a family of Veterinary Doctors and being actively involved in my father's farm operations have reinforced my passion for animal health, agricultural safety, and environmentally sustainable practices.

My areas of expertise include meat processing, preparation of sausages and smoked foods, artificial insemination of cows and pigs, management of broiler chickens, increasing reproductive efficiency in farms, and reducing mortality in newborn calves and abortions in dairy cows. I am confident that my skills and experience can contribute positively to Groupe Westc's operations.

I am excited about the opportunity to join your company and the Critical Worker Pilot of New Brunswick, and I am eager to use my knowledge and experience to support Groupe Westc's growth and success. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss my qualifications further and demonstrate my commitment to excellence in the field of animal health and production.

Yours sincerely,

[Your Name]

[Your Email Address]

[Your Phone Number]

The Art of Education University is seeking exceptional educators to produce video content for its YouTube channel, which has over 8,000 subscribers. Video Content Creators must have K-12 art experience, strong writing and communication skills, confident camera presence, technology proficiency, enthusiasm and knowledge of trends and best practices in art education, and the ability to adhere to strict deadlines.

Structured as a remote part-time, project-based, contractor position. This position will report to the Media Content Manager

We grow amazing teachers by providing rigorous, relevant, and engaging professional development at every stage of their career.

Submit written proposals and scripts, along with corresponding video content for a predetermined amount of episodes, to be published on The Art of Education University’s YouTube Channel.

We encourage applicants who believe they possess the necessary skills and experience to apply, regardless of whether they meet each requirement to the fullest extent.

Ability to use a laptop keyboard with accuracy.

Job Posting:
Full Job Description
Gloo was founded as a mission-driven organization with the goal to release the passion in every person to Champion the growth of another so they can be all they were born to be.

Today, organizations of all sizes in the faith space use Gloo’s products to become more informed, better connected, and fully equipped to overcome their greatest challenges and achieve powerful outcomes, helping people progress through their personal growth journeys.

By building a common platform, we are creating a shared infrastructure that removes friction, promotes collaboration, and equips leaders with the right tools to galvanize personal growth and change lives. We are a fast-moving and passionate team that is looking for more talented professionals who are driven to make a positive impact.

The Opportunity:
As the newest member of our team you'll be helping us develop and perpetuate the Gloo brand through video storytelling. You’ll work closely with our corporate marketing team and cross-team stakeholders to bring the Gloo story and our platform utility to life for our core customers. Your experience conceptualizing and executing imaginative, future-forward, yet accessible video all using your own innovation and skillset is the secret to your success. You'll be telling stories and teaching viewers through video in both the tech and faith categories, so leveraging any tech and faith experience background will help you convey compelling stories.

The Team:
Our corporate marketing team is passionate about building a stable brand narrative and equipping our people and the ecosystem to tell Gloo’s story well. Our team members are drivers-moving swiftly into action in response to market and team needs, and are personable, innovative, and aspire to live out Gloo’s mission. The culture of our team is extremely important to us. We want you to be engaged in your projects, we want you to voice your ideas, and we want you to be proud of your accomplishments toward our shared company goals.
What You'll Be Doing:
Collaborating with the corporate marketing team and cross-team stakeholders to develop and execute video concepts that align with our brand messaging and business objectives
Edit and produce videos from raw footage, adding visual effects, sound design, and other elements needed to enhance the quality and impact of your videos
Develop, maintain, and manage production timelines-from pre-production to post production, delivering high-quality videos on-brand and on-time
Optimize video content for our variety of platforms - from the Gloo platform to social media, websites, mobile, events, zoom, and more
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices, continually improving your skills in editing and up-leveling in areas like animation and sound design.
What We're Looking For:
A Bachelor's Degree (BA/BS) in Video Production, Film, Video Communications-commensurate experience may substitute for degree requirements
A minimum of 3 years of experience in an agency or video production organization
Expert proficiency in video editing software. Adobe Premier is Required
Experience in color grading is Required
Experience in motion graphics required, visual effects experience is a bonus!
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver high-quality work within tight deadlines
Advanced level competency with Google Suite
An intense curiosity for how storytelling and educational content can serve the learning journey
A deep commitment to delighting your customers
Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams and inputs from stakeholders
Ability to empathize with and successfully integrate constructive feedback
Ability to deliver meaning and intent in video, sound, writing and in your personal communication skills
A positive and energetic demeanor with the flexibility to work with ambiguity and emerging strategic explorations

Compensation: $55,000 - $70,000
Our Team Members Enjoy:
Compensation and bonus commensurate with experience
Plenty of time off to keep you balanced
Medical benefits with multiple plan offerings, HSA contribution, and Dental and Vision plans
A dynamic, talented team, dedicated to changing the world and building an incredible business
Onsite and virtual social events to keep us connected in our hybrid work environment
Beautiful office space in downtown Boulder on Pearl Street, steps from coffee shops and blocks from hiking trails
Applicants offered employment will be required to provide evidence of authorization to work in the United States, and will be required to work from a physical location within the United States in accordance with Gloo’s Remote Work Policies.

A 10 lbm metal ball has a temperature of 200° F when it is placed in a 50 lbm
bath of water at room temperature (72° F). Heat transfer occurs between the two
substances until equilibrium is reached. Find this equilibrium temperature.

To find the equilibrium temperature, we'll use the concept of energy conservation. We assume that the heat gained by the water is equal to the heat lost by the metal ball.

First, let's convert the temperatures from degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius:
Metal ball temperature: (200 - 32) * (5/9) ≈ 93.3°C
Water temperature: (72 - 32) * (5/9) ≈ 22.2°C

Let's denote the equilibrium temperature as T (in Celsius). We'll use the specific heat capacities (Cp) of the metal ball and water, which are given by:
Cp_water = 4.186 kJ/kg°C (for water)
Cp_metal = Cp_metal_ball (we didn't get the type of metal, so let's leave it as a variable)

Now let's apply the energy balance equation:

Heat gained by water = Heat lost by metal ball
(m_water * Cp_water * (T - T_water)) = (m_metal * Cp_metal * (T_metal - T))

Inserting the given values:
(50 kg * 4.186 kJ/kg°C * (T - 22.2°C)) = (4.535 kg * Cp_metal * (93.3°C - T))

To find T, we need to know the value of Cp_metal. If you provide the metal type, I can then solve for the equilibrium temperature T.

A 10 lbm metal ball has a temperature of 200° F when it is placed in a 50 lbm
bath of water at room temperature (72° F). Heat transfer occurs between the two
substances until equilibrium is reached. Find this equilibrium temperature.

To find the equilibrium temperature, we first need to convert the given masses from lbm (pound-mass) to kg (kilograms) and temperatures from degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius.

Mass conversions:
10 lbm = 10 * 0.453592 = 4.536 kg
50 lbm = 50 * 0.453592 = 22.68 kg

Temperature conversions:
Metal ball temperature: (200 - 32) * (5/9) ≈ 93.3°C
Water temperature: (72 - 32) * (5/9) ≈ 22.2°C

Next, let's denote the equilibrium temperature as T (in Celsius). We'll use the specific heat capacities (Cp) of water and assume that the metal ball is made of steel.
Cp_water = 4.186 kJ/kg°C (for water)
Cp_steel = 0.49 kJ/kg°C (for steel)

Apply the energy balance equation (heat gained by water = heat lost by metal ball):

m_water * Cp_water * (T - T_water) = m_metal * Cp_metal * (T_metal - T)

Inserting the values and solving for T:

(22.68 kg * 4.186 kJ/kg°C * (T - 22.2°C)) = (4.536 kg * 0.49 kJ/kg°C * (93.3°C - T))

95.134 * (T - 22.2) = 2.222 * (93.3 - T)

By multiplying both sides:

95.134T - 2111.98 ≈ 207.065 - 2.222T

Combining like terms:

97.356T ≈ 2318.045

Now find T:

T ≈ 23.8°C

Now to convert back to Fahrenheit:

T_F ≈ (23.8 * (9/5)) + 32 ≈ 74.84°F

Therefore, the equilibrium temperature is about 74.84°F.

POSTE:
Air Caraïbes Atlantique est une compagnie aérienne française régulière long courrier, spécialiste des Caraïbes et de la Guyane, au départ de Paris Orly.

French bee est la première compagnie low-cost et long courrier française. Elle dessert l'île de la Réunion, San Francisco, Tahiti, New York, Los Angeles et bientôt Miami.

Membres du pôle aérien du Groupe Dubreuil et premiers opérateurs français de l’A350, elles exploitent aujourd’hui 15 avions long-courrier Airbus dont sept A350-900 et quatre A350-1000.

Le centre opérationnel, basé sur la zone aéroportuaire d’Orly, est chargé de l’exploitation de la flotte long-courrier Airbus. Nos collaborateurs au sol assurent la préparation et le suivi des vols, la gestion des équipages, la supervision de la maintenance des avions et de l’assistance au sol.

Le Bureau d’étude, leader dans la démarche d’innovation des Opérations Aériennes, assure l’amélioration et le support de nos Opérations en Vol et travaille en transverse avec l'ensemble des entités opérationnelles de la compagnie (CCO, Maintenance, Opérations au sol, Formation des équipages, Programme et Direction Générale).

Description du poste

La compagnie recherche un(e) ingénieur pour renforcer ses équipes Opérations Aériennes afin d’assurer les missions suivantes pour les compagnies Air Caraïbes Atlantique et French bee :

· Gestion des performances avions : calcul des performances au décollage et à l’atterrissage, analyse des procédures et recherche d’optimisation. Administration des bases de données aéroports utilisées par les pilotes. Gestion des données de masse et centrage. Supervision des sous-traitants fournissant ces services ;

· Etude de nouvelles lignes et de vols ponctuels ;

· Gestion de la documentation opérationnelle et du système EFB ;

· Constitution des dossiers d’approbations opérationnelles, en relation avec la DGAC sur les aspects techniques ;

· Support au service de préparation et de suivi des vols (CCO) ;

· Mise à jour des manuels de vol (FCOM, QRH, MEL, FCTM, CDL, APD, etc.). Rédaction, élaboration et gestion du manuel d’Exploitation en coordination avec les différents services de la Compagnie ;

· Réalisation d’études liées au programme de Flight Efficiency ;

· Participer à l’amélioration continue des process opérations aériennes.

Vous évoluerez au sein d’une équipe dynamique, leader dans la démarche d’innovation des Opérations Aériennes.


Profil recherché

Diplômé d’une école d’ingénieur aéronautique avec un goût prononcé pour les opérations aériennes.

Le poste exige rigueur, organisation, dynamisme et esprit d’équipe ainsi qu’une capacité à devenir rapidement autonome et force de proposition.

Anglais courant indispensable. Une expérience en compagnie aérienne serait appréciée.

Objet : Candidature pour le poste d'Ingénieur Opérations Aériennes

À propos de moi

Madame, Monsieur,

Je me permets de vous adresser ma candidature pour le poste d'Ingénieur Opérations Aériennes au sein de vos compagnies Air Caraïbes Atlantique et French bee. Diplômé de l'ISAE-SUPAERO avec une spécialisation en Observation de la Terre et Neuro-IA, j'ai eu l'occasion d'acquérir de solides compétences techniques et un vif intérêt pour le domaine aéronautique lors de mon expérience de stage au sein du BEA. J'ai également développé une aisance avec les langues étrangères, notamment l'anglais et l'allemand, grâce à mon parcours académique et professionnel.

Pourquoi Air Caraïbes et French bee?

Je suis particulièrement attiré par les compagnies Air Caraïbes Atlantique et French bee en raison de leur leadership dans l'innovation opérationnelle et leur engagement envers la démarche d'amélioration continue. En tant que premier opérateur français de l'A350 et membres du pôle aérien du Groupe Dubreuil, vous représentez l'excellence française en matière de transport aérien long-courrier. De plus, votre centre opérationnel basé à Orly offre des opportunités uniques de collaboration avec les différents services et entités de la compagnie, permettant ainsi de contribuer activement au développement et à la performance de vos opérations aériennes.

Pourquoi moi?

Je suis convaincu que mon profil correspond aux exigences du poste et que je pourrais rapidement devenir autonome et force de proposition au sein de vos équipes. Ma rigueur, mon organisation et mon esprit d'équipe me permettront de mener à bien les missions qui me seront confiées. De plus, mes compétences en gestion des performances avions, étude de nouvelles lignes et de vols ponctuels, gestion de la documentation opérationnelle et support aux services de préparation et de suivi des vols seront un atout pour vos compagnies.

Je suis très enthousiaste à l'idée d'intégrer l'équipe dynamique des Opérations Aériennes et de participer à vos projets innovants pour renforcer la position des compagnies Air Caraïbes Atlantique et French bee sur le marché de l'aviation long-courrier. Je me tiens à votre disposition pour un entretien afin de discuter de ma candidature et suis disponible immédiatement.

Je vous prie d'agréer, Madame, Monsieur, l'expression de mes salutations distinguées.

Lucas Cavatoni

This is the Job Description:  Operations Manager
F45 Training Burleigh Heads
Burleigh Heads, Gold Coast QLD
Fitness & Personal Training (Sport & Recreation)
Full time
$65,000 – $75,000 per year
Posted 2d ago
More jobs from this company
CULTURE THAT CRUSHES IT

Our mission at F45 is to create the world’s greatest workout. This isn’t only about creating an unbelievable fitness experience—it’s about building a community and culture.

 

We are seeking a superstar Operations Manager to join our beautiful Burleigh Heads Studio: 
 

Benefits:

Flexible working schedule
Competitive salary and bonus structure
Virtual Assistant provided
Active ownership group
One of the largest F45 Studios in Australia.
 

Key Responsibilities:

Create, manage and exceed, all Sales and Operational budgets & goals
Drive financial plans and increase gross margins of the business through optimal programming and capacity utilization
Ensure all systems and studio practices/processes are adhered to.
Ensure a consistent sales effort is maintained at all times by providing daily sales goals and contests/incentive-based motivation, including establishing, expanding, and tracking outreach initiatives and strategic partnerships with local businesses, community groups, and charitable organizations
Recruit, hire, train and deliver the onboarding program for all staff
Maintain and grow the total membership base and oversee all aspects of the membership sales process
Increase studio conversion rate and achieve client retention goals
Drive client referral program
Maintain top-notch cleanliness, appearance, and organization of the studio and inventory
Demonstrate positive attitude and actions through a display of courtesy, service, cooperation, hospitality, sensitivity and professionalism to both clients and internal staff
Ensure studio branding by adhering to company guidelines and values
Maintain strong working knowledge of our small-group training programs.
Manage and oversee all day-to-day operations and overall studio performance. 
 

Qualifications:

Equivalent work experience, required
5+ years of proven sales leadership in the Health & Fitness industry required
Must have Personal Training Certification through a nationally recognized organization
Must have CPR/AED/First Aid Certification
3+ years of management experience, including directly overseeing all aspects of staff management from hiring, training, supporting, disciplining, and terminating
Must have outstanding experience delivering high-quality customer service, excellent communication, organizational, and written skills
Must possess excellent leadership and management skills to create a positive, successful environment for staff and clients
Ability to work independently and collaborate with Studio Owner, Sales Associates, and client
Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Computer proficiency with MS Office programs, MindBody Online, as well as various media platforms

Programmed Skilled Workforce are looking to fulfil several opportunities with a large recreational venue, where schools and other groups visit for educational and leisure activities.

Key aspects of the role include facilitating high quality and safe sport and recreation programs/activities for individuals and groups, continuous improvement to community-based programs whilst interacting with different visitors to ensure a high-level client experience.

If you enjoy a fast paced work environment, facilitating outdoor recreational activities with different visitors and groups and offering a high level of customer experience whilst ensuring safety - this role is for you! On the job training and development, work life balance and make a difference in the community.

The current roster requires new staff members to join the team and cover bookings/shifts, Monday to Sunday availability.

Duties and responsibilities will include but will not be not limited to:

Safely facilitate high quality sport and recreation activities and programs for individuals and groups in line with venue procedures.
Provide input to the development and continuous improvement of a broad range of community-based program and other initiatives as required, to increase the participation of Queenslanders in sport and recreation programs
Adhere to risk management practices associated with providing sport and recreation activities to Venue clients
Assist with the implementation of, and adhere to, activity specific policies and procedures for the safe, efficient and effective running of programs and activities
Comply with workplace health and safety requirements, industry regulations and standards and the statewide program framework
Support the delivery of appropriate standards of client service and relationship management within the Venue and local community
Ensure that accompanying teachers / group leaders have a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities while conducting activities at the Venue
Undertake administrative and program related duties as required.
What we are looking for:

Certificate 3 or higher in Outdoor Leadership or activity specific skill sets from the Outdoor Leadership Training Package
Previous experience in a similar role (tourism, recreation and hospitality industries)
Positive Blue card - mandatory or willingness to obtain for starting
Current first aid and CPR certificates or willingness to obtain for starting
Availability for all operational hours

This internship would offer me invaluable exposure to phonetics and phonology, thereby aiding me in achieving my academic pursuits.
is a 200 words cover letter brief

That depends on the specific requirements of the job application. In general, a cover letter should be concise and to the point while still demonstrating your qualifications and enthusiasm for the position. A length of 200 words can be appropriate for some job applications but may be too short for others.

If the job posting specifically mentions a word count or page limit for the cover letter, it is important to follow those guidelines. Otherwise, aim to convey your qualifications and interest in the position as effectively and efficiently as possible, using a length that feels appropriate for the job and your individual experience.

In any case, prioritize quality over quantity in your cover letter. It is better to have a shorter but well-written and personalized letter that effectively communicates your skills and enthusiasm than a longer, generic letter that fails to stand out.
it just says brief, do you think 200 is too long

If the job posting specifies a "brief" cover letter, it typically means that the employer expects a concise and focused letter. It is better to err on the side of being too short rather than too long for a brief cover letter. 

In this case, a cover letter that is 200 words long can be appropriate, as it shows that you are able to convey your skills and experience clearly and concisely. However, it's important to ensure that your letter is well-structured, highlights your relevant skills and achievements, and is tailored to the job requirements to make a strong impact.

Position: Social Media Manager at Children's Camp

Job Summary:
We are looking for a creative and enthusiastic Social Media Manager to build and maintain the social media presence of our children's camp. The Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies across various platforms to increase our online presence, engage with our followers, and promote our programs and events.

Key Responsibilities:
• Create and publish engaging social media content (including posts, videos, and images) on various platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube
• Monitor, track, and analyze social media performance and engagement metrics to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement
• Develop and execute social media campaigns to promote camp programs, events, and initiatives
• Manage and respond to social media inquiries, comments, and messages in a timely and professional manner
• Collaborate with camp staff to create and source content for social media campaigns and promotions
• Stay up-to-date with social media trends, tools, and best practices and continuously improve our social media strategy and tactics
• Prepare regular reports to track and communicate social media progress and ROI
• Ensure all social media content aligns with the camp's mission, values, and brand guidelines
• Foster a positive and engaging online community for parents, children, and staff

Qualifications and Skills:
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Marketing, Digital Media or Communications
• At least 2 years of experience in social media management, preferably in the education or youth development sector
• Knowledge of social media platforms, analytics tools, and content creation tools
• Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with attention to detail
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to work independently, adapt to changes, and multitask in a fast-paced environment
• Passion for kids and youth development programs
• Basic graphic design skills are a plus

This is a full-time position with a competitive salary and benefits package. If you are passionate about creating impactful social media marketing campaigns to promote children's camp programs and events, we want to hear from you!

Madame, Monsieur,

Ayant appris la disponibilité d'un poste de Responsable Achats au sein de votre prestigieuse entreprise, je me permets de vous soumettre ma candidature. Fort d'une solide expérience de plus de 10 ans en tant qu'acheteur, je suis convaincu que je pourrais contribuer efficacement à la croissance de votre marque emblématique et renforcer votre position dominante sur le marché du luxe.

Au cours de ma carrière, j'ai travaillé sur divers secteurs, tels que les plastiques, le caoutchouc, les logiciels et l'électronique. J'ai suivi et accompagné les évolutions du marché et les différentes innovations technologiques, ce qui m'a permis de développer une expertise approfondie dans la gestion des achats et la collaboration avec des fournisseurs de grande taille, ainsi qu'avec des startups dynamiques.

Rejoindre Hermès, c'est intégrer une entreprise phare du luxe à la française et défendre un héritage exceptionnel. Ce serait pour moi un réel honneur d'apporter ma contribution et mon savoir-faire à une marque aussi prestigieuse que la vôtre.

Title: Multi-Trade Construction Worker Wanted – London & Brighton

Are you a talented, self-starter with a range of construction skills and experience? Do you pride yourself on delivering quality workmanship, and are you willing to travel between London and Brighton for various projects? If so, we want to hear from you!

We are an established construction company, seeking an experienced and skilled multi-trade construction worker to join our team. Our ideal candidate will have a strong preference for roofing, but all-round knowledge and ability to work on diverse aspects of construction projects would be highly beneficial.

Responsibilities:

- Carry out a wide range of construction tasks, including roofing, carpentry, plumbing, and more.
- Ensure all work is carried out to the highest standard and adheres to safety regulations.
- Work as part of a team, but able to complete tasks efficiently and independently when required.
- Communicate effectively with clients, colleagues, and management.
- Be punctual, reliable, and able to meet deadlines.
- Travel between London and Brighton as needed for various projects.

Requirements:

- A minimum of 3 years' experience working in a multi-trade construction role, preferably with roofing experience.
- Full UK driving license and access to own van for transportation of tools and equipment.
- Possess a comprehensive set of tools necessary for completing varied construction tasks.
- Flexibility to work across various locations, with a willingness to travel between London and Brighton.
- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to complete tasks effectively and efficiently.
- A team player with a positive attitude and excellent communication skills.
- Required qualifications, such as CSCS card and relevant trade certifications.

What we offer:

- Competitive day rate ranging from £140 - £180 (based on experience and qualifications).
- The opportunity to work within a supportive and experienced team.
- Varied projects, offering the chance to expand and develop your skills.
- A friendly and professional working environment.

If you meet the requirements and believe you would be the right fit for this position, please submit your CV and a brief cover letter explaining why you would be the ideal candidate for this role. We look forward to speaking with you and potentially welcoming you to our team!

(Job reference: MTW-LB-001)

conversations.facetValue: assist the user in writing a cover letter in response to a job posting for an Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist position.

allFacetValues.value: write a cover letter in response to a job posting for an Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist position at Wayfinding Partners.
English
assist the user in writing a cover letter in response to a job posting for an Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist position.

conversation.content:
write a cover letter in response to this job posting:  Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist

Wayfinding Partners is seeking a motivated, justice-driven associate consultant to join our growing team. This role is integral to the success of our client engagements and racial justice programs.

We’re seeking individuals who have strong project management skills, growing ease with facilitation, the ability to solve complex problems, and a knack for relationship-building.

This person must also have familiarity with the nonprofit and philanthropic sectors and has a nuanced understanding of how oppression operates at varying levels.

The ideal candidate has also demonstrated a commitment to and aptitude for each of the Wayfinding values: justice in action, empathy and connection, community and self care, emergence and magic, and the fractal nature of existence and change.

WORKING WITH WAYFINDING PARTNERS
The mission of Wayfinding Partners is to guide people, organizations, and communities on a journey of self-discovery, and build their capacity to design and thrive in change.

We partner with folks to learn from and reckon with history, heal in the present, and create a just, equitable, joy-filled future. Our philosophy is that by undoing the systems, structures and mindsets that perpetuate inequities, we make space for justice and liberation.

Wayfinding Partners is a completely remote team. We travel for team retreats and client engagements.

THE ROLE
The Associate Consultant reports to a Senior Consultant, and serves as a key support in the delivery of Wayfinding Partner’s consulting engagements and community initiatives. This Associate Consultant role works directly with organizations in the nonprofit, philanthropic, and public sectors, conducting organizational needs assessments, designing and implementing strategic interventions, and guiding organizational culture change. Associate Consultants also support, and in some cases facilitate, community programs.

We meet our clients where they are and customize our work according to their growth opportunities, readiness for change, and desired outcomes. As such, each client engagement looks slightly different. However, there are core opportunities and responsibilities unique to the Associate Consultant role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategic Advising

Assist Senior Consultants in coordinating fieldwork by contributing to the development of project plans, scheduling and preparing for workshops and interviews, gathering documentation, and liaising with client staff
Survey and understand the external landscape or “ecosystem” in which clients conduct their work to identify opportunities and challenges
Assist Senior Consultants in assessing clients’ capacity—structures, culture, funding, racial equity lens—and guide clients’ approach to improve and strengthen their organizational systems and leadership
Actively partner with Senior Consultants to identify and articulate potential pathways for clients to consider to help maximize their impact and achieve their goals
Analysis and Storytelling

Review and analyze quantitative and qualitative data, including research reports, stakeholder interview notes, and background materials
Lead and actively participate in team meetings to discuss and develop findings and recommendations
Develop written reports and presentations summarizing analysis and recommendations
Design, Facilitation, and Holding Space

Work with Senior Consultants to design meetings, retreats, and events, including preparing internal and external agendas
Facilitate portions of client meetings, retreats, and small group sessions
Facilitate community events, including elements of signature workshops and cohort programs
Project Management

Work closely with Senior Consultants to maintain and update each project’s schedule of events, communicating any changes to the full consulting team and client throughout engagement
Build meaningful client relationships, through all interactions, and ensure they remain engaged in the project
Coordinate with consulting teams and the client to create and send calendar invites for engagements
Attend client meetings to take notes and assist in any facilitations
Ensure all documentation pertaining to each client is uploaded to the client folder on the shared drive
Create and maintain documents per client to track all engagement deliverables, ensuring activities and coaching hours align with client contract.
Support Senior Consultants in ensuring deliverables are completed in a timely manner, communicating any changes to the client.
Wayfinding Culture Curation and Care-Taking

Model Wayfinding values in action, paying particular attention to self- and community-care.
Uplift opportunities for the Wayfinding team to be in community with each other
Continuously brainstorm and make recommendations for how to make Wayfinding a liberated workplace
QUALIFICATIONS
We recognize that one candidate may not possess every desired qualification listed below. We also know that this list is not exhaustive of all the wonderful qualities that could make you successful in this role—we hope you share those with us in your cover letter. As we search for our next teammate, we are looking for the following:

Minimum of three (3) years of relevant full time professional experience in the nonprofit or philanthropic sectors. Experience in organization development, education, and/or nonprofit management is preferred.
Clear point of view on racial equity, social justice, liberation—and eagerness for ongoing growth, dialogue, and learning
Comfort, tenacity, and grace in developing relationships across culture, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ability, political affiliation, and other forms of difference
Comfort in giving and receiving positive and constructive feedback to colleagues and clients
Capacity to handle multiple tasks, remain flexible, prioritize appropriately, and manage workflow for oneself and others
Highly motivated self-starter with demonstrated comfort taking initiative, learning quickly, and working in virtual environments
Excitement in the recognition that we are learning all the time, and eagerness to use challenges as opportunities to gain new knowledge
Energy Transfer (i.e. Compensation)
In recognition and appreciation of team members’ partnership with Wayfinding and our clients, we offer salaries commensurate with experience and benefits that emphasize health, family, and wellness.

The salary range for the Associate Consultant position is $65,000 - $75,000. Our benefits package includes paid time off, wellness days, paid holidays, 401(k) retirement plans, health care reimbursement, long-term disability plans, along with other fun sprinkled throughout the year. Wayfinding Partners also closes for one week in summer and the last two weeks of the calendar year.

[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[City, State, ZIP]
[Email Address]
[Phone Number]
[Today’s Date]

[Wayfinding Partners Hiring Manager's Name]
Wayfinding Partners
[Company Address]
[City, State, ZIP]

Dear [Hiring Manager's Name],

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist position at Wayfinding Partners, as advertised on your website. With my extensive experience in the nonprofit and philanthropic sectors along with my passion for racial equity, social justice, and liberation, I believe I am an ideal candidate to join the mission-driven team at Wayfinding Partners.

Throughout my professional career, I have honed my project management skills, developed a proficiency in facilitation, and cultivated a knack for relationship building. My familiarity with the nonprofit and philanthropic sectors has provided me with a nuanced understanding of how oppression operates at varying levels. Moreover, I have dedicated my career to embodying the values of justice in action, empathy and connection, community and self care, emergence and magic, and the fractal nature of existence and change.

In my previous role at [Nonprofit Organization], I supported organization needs assessments, implemented strategic interventions, and guided organizational culture change. I have demonstrated my abilities in strategic advising, analyzing and storytelling, designing and facilitating meetings and events, as well as managing projects with efficiency and adaptability. My passion for building strong relationships and developing innovative solutions has consistently propelled our team to exceed goals and create lasting impact for our clients.

My background boasts a proven track record of fostering positive relationships across culture, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ability, and political affiliation. As a highly motivated self-starter, I thrive in virtual environments and display resilience in taking initiatives while adapting to changes. I believe my eagerness for ongoing growth, dialogue, and learning perfectly aligns with the culture and goals of Wayfinding Partners.

I am excited about the opportunity to contribute my skills and expertise to Wayfinding Partners, and help guide clients on their journeys of self-discovery, capacity building, and thriving in change. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss my candidacy further and learn more about the Associate Consultant / Client Engagement Specialist position.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

conversation.content:
Write a cover letter for applying for a post-doctoral position at MIT University in the transportation engineering department.
First, introduce me:
I was born in a small city, but I always had big dreams, and I want to change my world and the whole world to make it a better place to live. From years of my undergraduate education to now, I have always dreamed of enhancing my academic and personal qualifications by participating in international studies. So I choose Transportation engineering to make people's lives easier and safer by solving traffic problems and increasing traffic safety to create a better and safer world. I always do my best in my field. I get the Middle East Technical University Tuition Fee Exemption Scholarship award for four years, the Tubitak conference scholarship for two conferences, and a government scholarship for the top ten university students.
Second, introduce my master's education:
I want to explain my educational background and relative experiences up to this point.
After completing my undergraduate studies at Urmia University, department of civil engineering, in 2010, I applied for a master's degree at Middle East Technical University (Ankara, Turkey), also in Transportation engineering. During my master's degree, I took courses on various topics such as Transportation policy, Traffic Eng.1, City planning policy, Traffic psychology, urban design, and Travel demand modeling and forecasting. I wrote my thesis entitled 'Estimation of Traffic Impact at Signalized Intersections around the Proposed Health Campus in Etlik, Ankara, by Using PTV Vistro and Synchro Simulation Software' with the help of my thesis advisor Assoc. Prof. Dr. Hediye TuydesYaman. In my study, I have estimated the current and predicted the future level of service (LOS), traffic impact analysis (TIA), and Origin-Destination matrix for the project about the proposed health campus in Etlik, Ankara.
Third, introduce my Ph.D. education:
In the fall of 2017, I was admitted to the Transportation and Department of Middle East Technical University as a Ph.D. student. During the Ph. D., I strengthened my knowledge of public transport and computer science-based courses, which I intend to follow during my thesis studies. For my Ph.D. studies, I focused on the performance of public transit, GIS, R studio, and big data analysis. My thesis topic is estimating public transit performance based on smart card data. At the end of my thesis, I suggested a formula for the performance rate for public transit according to passenger number, attraction rate, and user perspective.
Fourth, introduce my work experience:
During my study, I worked as a research assistant and teaching assistant. Also, I have a great experience in PUYOL Engineering and consultancy company as a manager of transportation and traffic projects such as Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan (SUMP), traffic impact analysis, macro simulation, micro simulation, public transport planning, signal optimization, green wave, road safety audit, and feasibility projects.
Fifth, introduce my area of interest:
I have more than ten years of professional expertise in Transportation and Traffic engineering fields to design and analyze:
Intelligent Transportation systems (ITS), Intersection Design, Intersection Safety Analysis, Traffic Impact Analysis (TIA),
Traffic Optimization, Level of Service (LOS), Traffic Modelling, Traffic Simulation, Traffic Safety Analysis, Public Transportation System, Traffic Psychology, GIS, Spatial Analysis, Transportation planning and management, Urban Planning, Statistics, Big data analysis, Project Management, and Designing roadway traffic signs.
Moreover, I know five langue which helps me always find new opportunities in my carrier.
Sixth, introduce my references:
I would appreciate it if you considered me for the scholarship. I would also like to mention that my Professor (Prof.Dr. HEDİYE TÜYDEŞ YAMAN <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS> ) and my co-advisor (Prof.Dr. Ela BABALIK SUTCLIFFE <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS> ) can provide the recommendation letters.
Seventh, introduce motivation to apply:
This post-doc position at MIT University directly relates to my field of studies and fits with my experience. Participating in the Transportation Lab at MIT University will give me a great chance to learn about the research environment and experience there.
Eighth, wait to reply:
I am highly motivated to fulfill the program's requirements to the fullest, and I eagerly look forward to being a part of the MIT transportation department.
Many thanks for considering my request. Best Regards
